intro: Crotalaria naragutensis, commonly known as the Naragutensian false falsepea, is a flowering plant belonging to the Fabaceae family. It is native to the tropical regions of South America, particularly Brazil. The plant is characterized by its distinctive yellow flowers and compound leaves. It grows in open areas and is often found in disturbed soils. Crotalaria naragutensis is known for its toxic properties, making it a plant to avoid in both wildlife and human environments.
